title: Pather Panchali
description: Pather Panchali portrays the simple yet poignant life of a poor rural family in Bengal.It follows young Apu and his sister Durga as they navigate childhood amid hardship and dreams.The film captures the beauty of village life alongside the harsh realities of poverty and loss.Through its quiet storytelling, it reflects deep human emotions and the innocence of childhood.'

title: Aparajito
description: A young boy, Apu, moves with his mother to the city after his father’s death.He excels in school and dreams of higher education, growing distant from home.The bond between mother and son is tested by ambition and longing.A tale of growth, loss, and the quiet ache of leaving loved ones behind.

title: Parash Pathar
description: A humble bank clerk stumbles upon a stone that turns anything into gold. Sudden wealth brings him fame, luxury, and temptation beyond control. As greed and chaos spiral, he realizes the burden of unnatural fortune. A sharp satire that blends fantasy with a cautionary tale about desire.

title: Jalsaghar
description: An aging zamindar clings to his fading aristocratic pride through lavish musical soirées. As wealth dwindles and modernity rises, he resists change with stubborn elegance. His empty mansion echoes the decline of a bygone era. A haunting tale of loss, ego, and the passage of time.

title: Apur Sansar
description: Apu, now an adult, navigates life, love, and fatherhood amidst personal tragedies. His unexpected marriage blossoms into a deep bond, only to be tested by fate. Grief shapes his journey as he seeks purpose and redemption. A tender exploration of human resilience and connection.

title: Devi (The Goddess)
description: In 19th-century Bengal, a young woman is believed to be an incarnation of the goddess Kali. Her father-in-law's blind faith leads to a tragic transformation of her identity. As devotion turns into obsession, her reality blurs with divinity. The film explores faith, superstition, and psychological turmoil.

title: Teen Kanya
description: Teen Kanya is an anthology of three stories based on Rabindranath Tagore's works. Each tale explores the lives of different women, highlighting themes of love, identity, and independence. From innocence to resilience, the characters navigate emotional and societal challenges. The film captures the depth of human emotion in varied narratives.

title: Kanchenjungha
description: Kanchenjungha follows a wealthy Bengali family on a day trip to Darjeeling. As they walk through the scenic hills, tensions rise, secrets unfold, and personal conflicts come to light. The story captures individual struggles against familial expectations. Nature mirrors the emotional journey of the characters throughout the film.

title: Abhijan
description: Abhijan centers on a proud and hot-tempered taxi driver who becomes entangled in smuggling and moral dilemmas. Set in rural Bengal, the film explores themes of honor, redemption, and human connection. As the driver bonds with his passengers, his worldview begins to shift. It's a tale of transformation against a complex social backdrop.

title: Mahanagar
description: Mahanagar follows a housewife who takes up a job to support her family, challenging traditional gender roles. Set in bustling Calcutta, it explores the tension between modernity and conservatism. Her journey toward independence causes both conflict and growth within the household. The film highlights the subtle strength of everyday women.

title: Charulata
description: Charulata follows the lonely and intelligent wife of a newspaper editor in 19th-century Bengal. When her husband's cousin arrives, an emotional and intellectual connection blossoms. The film delicately explores themes of longing, creativity, and unspoken desire. It’s a poignant portrait of a woman’s inner world and restrained passions.

title: Kapurush
description: Kapurush tells the story of a screenwriter who unexpectedly reunites with his former lover at her husband's home. Haunted by past cowardice, he struggles with regret and what could have been. The film explores themes of lost love, missed opportunities, and emotional paralysis. It’s a subtle, introspective look at the human cost of inaction.

title: Mahapurush
description: Mahapurush is a satirical tale about a self-proclaimed godman who captivates a wealthy family with his mystical claims. As the guru’s stories grow increasingly outrageous, doubt begins to creep in. The film humorously critiques blind faith and spiritual exploitation. It’s a sharp, witty exploration of belief, deception, and social gullibility.

title: Nayak (The Hero)
description: Nayak follows a matinee idol on a train journey where he reflects on his fame, failures, and inner conflicts. Through a candid interview with a young journalist, layers of his persona unravel. The film delves into the cost of stardom and the vulnerability behind public image. It’s a compelling psychological drama about identity and self-realization.

title: Chiriyakhana
description: Chiriyakhana is a gripping detective mystery featuring the iconic sleuth Byomkesh Bakshi. Tasked with solving a murder in a colony of outcasts, he navigates a web of hidden pasts and secrets. The film blends suspense with social commentary on marginalization. It’s a classic whodunit set against a uniquely atmospheric backdrop.

title: Goopy Gyne Bagha Byne
description: Goopy Gyne Bagha Byne is a fantastical adventure of a singer and a drummer who receive magical powers from forest spirits. Banished from their villages, they embark on a whimsical journey filled with music, friendship, and heroism. Using their gifts, they outwit evil and bring peace to warring kingdoms. It’s a joyful blend of satire, fantasy, and timeless charm.

title: Aranyer Din Ratri
description: Aranyer Din Ratri follows four urban friends who escape to the countryside for a carefree holiday. Amidst the forest's calm, their encounters with local women spark introspection and emotional upheaval. The film explores themes of class, masculinity, and the contrast between civilization and nature. It’s a nuanced study of human behavior and unspoken desires.

title: Pratidwandi
description: Pratidwandi centers on a young man struggling with unemployment and disillusionment in a rapidly changing Kolkata. Through fragmented memories and present-day challenges, his internal conflict unfolds. The film critiques societal pressures, generational gaps, and the search for identity. It’s a powerful reflection on youth caught between idealism and harsh reality.

title: Seemabaddha
description: Seemabaddha portrays the ambitious rise of a corporate executive in Calcutta’s competitive business world. When his idealistic sister-in-law visits, his moral compromises come to light. The film examines the cost of success, ethical erosion, and the illusion of progress. It’s a sharp critique of corporate culture and personal integrity.

title: Ashani Sanket
description: Ashani Sanket is set during the Bengal famine of 1943, focusing on a humble village priest and his wife. As hunger spreads, their quiet life is upended by desperation and societal collapse. The film contrasts human dignity with the horrors of starvation and war. It’s a haunting, lyrical portrayal of suffering and resilience.

title: Sonar Kella
description: Sonar Kella follows young Mukul, who recalls a past life in a golden fortress, drawing the interest of criminals and detective Feluda. The chase leads across Rajasthan’s deserts, blending mystery, adventure, and folklore. With sharp wit and vivid landscapes, the story captivates both young and old. It’s a timeless detective tale filled with intrigue and charm.

title: Jana Aranya
description: Jana Aranya explores the descent of an honest young man into the morally corrupt world of business in Kolkata. As he struggles to find work, he’s gradually drawn into a web of compromise and exploitation. The film starkly portrays the clash between ethics and survival. It’s a powerful commentary on societal decay and lost ideals.

title: Shatranj Ke Khilari
description: Shatranj Ke Khilari is set in 19th-century Lucknow, where two noblemen obsess over chess while their kingdom faces British annexation. Their apathy mirrors the aristocracy’s detachment from political reality. The film masterfully blends personal folly with historical tragedy. It’s a rich, ironic tale of distraction, decay, and colonial conquest.

title: Joi Baba Felunath
description: Joi Baba Felunath takes detective Feluda to Varanasi, where a stolen idol leads to a deeper conspiracy. As the mystery unfolds, Feluda confronts a cunning adversary in a city of ancient secrets. The film combines suspense, intellect, and cultural richness. It’s a classic detective thriller with a spiritual and cerebral edge.

title: Hirak Rajar Deshe
description: Hirak Rajar Deshe reunites Goopy and Bagha as they confront a tyrannical king who silences dissent through brainwashing. With music, wit, and courage, they inspire a rebellion against oppression. The film blends fantasy with sharp political satire and poetic justice. It’s an imaginative, empowering tale about the triumph of truth and freedom.

title: Ghare Baire
description: Ghare Baire is set during the Swadeshi movement and explores the tensions between nationalism, personal freedom, and gender roles. A love triangle unfolds as a progressive woman is caught between her husband and his passionate friend. The film delves into ideology, loyalty, and emotional complexity. It’s a poignant, layered drama of love and political awakening.

title: Ganashatru
description: Ganashatru follows a principled doctor who discovers a contaminated temple water source causing an epidemic in his town. When he speaks out, he faces resistance from corrupt officials and blind faith. The film examines truth versus power, science versus superstition. It’s a gripping modern parable about integrity in the face of societal denial.

title: Shakha Proshakha
description: Shakha Proshakha revolves around a respected patriarch whose birthday gathering reveals deep moral divisions among his sons. As hidden truths and personal conflicts emerge, the family’s facade begins to crumble. The film explores themes of ethics, generational values, and disillusionment. It’s a contemplative portrait of familial bonds tested by modern life.

title: Agantuk
description: Agantuk tells the story of a mysterious man who claims to be a long-lost uncle returning home after decades abroad. His unconventional views and probing questions challenge the family’s beliefs and assumptions. The film explores themes of identity, trust, and cultural relativism. It’s a thoughtful, philosophical journey into human connection and the search for truth.
